label: Description
value: The door frame shows a shell in the overdoor and a triangular pediment. It is flanked by embedded fluted columns. A window is above the door; its frame is flanked by urns with fires.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and grey washes, black chalk on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A frame with curved, chamfered corners decorated at the top with putti, one holding a ribbon inscribed "Dum Spiro Spero," above an escutcheon showing a rampant lion and three crescents. At either side, flying putti hold rose garlands. At the bottom, water and fruit spill from three overturned vases, two other escutcheons, a mace and oars. The frame rests on a stone base with attached rings at either side.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Assemblage of vases and urns in a classical cemetary. Some stand on pedestals, others are on the ground. At lower left the vases are on two applied pieces of paper. Bordered in brush and black ink.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux; 1911: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: This triangular shaped frame holds a composition of an Ionic pediment with an urn on top; the whole surrounded by an ovoidal wreath. A flower swag suspened from rosettes at the upper corners.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on white paper, pricked for transfer

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value:
Left: Tall shaft decorated with two rams heads, drafted in garlands, below a portrait plaque containing a profile of a woman facing left, base baring central relief of putti. 
Center: two winged putti flank a talla antique-style urn from which arises a bust of Bacchus, the base bears an eagle in relief. 
Right: Above base two sphinxes flank medallion relief depicting three figures and billowing smoke, surmounted by trophy of birds, a quiver of arrows and pumes at top.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on off-white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Elevation of a Mausoleum for a Soldier (Temple of Mars)

label: Description
value: The depicted structure has a square plan and low dome.  The central doorway is flanked by two obelisks with trophies.  They are placed upon semi-circular pedestals.  The structure includes a frieze, between the base and the dome, with figurative decoration.  Small scale figures (crowds) surround the building.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and black, gray wash over black chalk indications on off-white laid paper, lined

Perspective Rendering of the Chateau de Verneuil, France

label: Description
value: Frontal view of a two-storied architectural structure, with square corner pavilions an additional story in height, enclosing a court. The side nearest the viewer is a single story in height, and is broken by a circular pavilion, surmounted by a dome. The whole structure stands on a high platform whose access is gained by a drawbridge, flanked by guard boxes.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and blue, gray wash on wove paper

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Hippolyte Destailleur (sale, Paris, May 19, l896, no. 159); L on Decloux (after 1906).

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: A singerie, a work from the visual arts genre characterized by depictions of monkeys imitating human behavior, often fashionably attired. A female monkey is depicted in Rococo dress, consisting of a blue and white gown, a fluffy white hat with feathers, and a pink muff which she holds in front of her. She is sitting in the center of the composition against a peach-colored background, resting on a portion of a blue frame with pink floral garlands beneath her.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache over graphite on thin board

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux, Paris, France; 1911: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a wall of a ballroom

label: Description
value: Four and half bays of the elevation of a wall of seven bays are shown. Steps are to lead downwards into the hall in the three central bays. Chandeliers with burning candles hang in each bay. The upper parts of the backs of the two lateral bays are undefined, but dados are at the bottom. Rich decoration in a kind of early rococo. The wall panels are to show alternatively statues standing on pedestals and flanked by candle brackets and trophies of attributes of Cupid under canopies in the upper parts, and console tables with candle brackets before mirrors. Under the top centers of the mirrors are medallions with a fleur-de-lys each. On top alternate escutcheons with monograms of Marie Antoinette and Louis with painted love scenes and putti on top of the mirrors. Paper margins.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor, graphite on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Léon Decloux; 1911; Acquired by Museum through the Advisory Council

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description

value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Preliminary Design for the Salon d'Angle at the Palais Royal, Paris, France

label: Description
value: The sectional elevation shows a two-storied chamber, the second story indicated by a balcony. Roof construction is also shown.The design continues to the left with the outlines of a roof and the elevation of a wall, showing a dado and an entablature with brackets, and toward the lower right a section of the substructure. Details of interior include fireplace and mantle with candelabra, a large mirror, sculptures in niches, and richly ornamented walls. Remnant of a framing line at bottom edge.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Notes
value: The sectional elevation shows a two-storied chamber, the second story indicated by a balcony. Roof construction is also shown.The design continues to the left with the outlines of a roof and the elevation of a wall, showing a dado and an entablature with brackets, and toward the lower right a section of the substructure. Details of interior include fireplace and mantle with candelabra, a large mirror, sculptures in niches, and richly ornamented walls. Remnant of a framing line at bottom edge.
Hall Decoration, Hotel des Menus-Plaisirs, for the Assemblee des Notables

label: Description
value: A depiction of a large hall.  A barrel-vaulted coffered ceiling above, with a semicircular niche containing the arms of France flanked by allegorical figures placed at the center.  Below, the back wall displays three tapestries with elaborate frames, showing battle scenes from the time of Louis XIV, and between, statues in niches, with reliefs above, and flanked by fasces.  A dado and raised platform at the left are also indicated.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray and rose wash, black chalk indications on two sheets of paper, joined together horizontally at center

label: Provenance
